universum.studios.android.intent

Class ContentIntent.ContentHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • universum.studios.android.intent.ContentIntent.ContentHandler
  • Enclosing class:
    ContentIntent<I extends ContentIntent<I>>

    public static class ContentIntent.ContentHandler
extends Object
    A ContentHandler is a simple class that may be used to add one item into ContentIntent builder. Such an item will be than displayed in a chooser dialog with all added handler items. Each ContentHandler must have its name specified that will be displayed in a list item's view. There must be also specified an intent that will be started whenever an item of a particular handler is clicked.
    Author:
    Martin Albedinsky
    See Also:
    ContentHandler#ContentHandler(CharSequence, Intent)

    • Constructor Detail

      • ContentHandler

        public ContentHandler(@NonNull
                      CharSequence name,
                      @NonNull
                      Intent intent)
        Creates a new instance of ContentHandler with the specified name and intent.

        Note, that the given intent will be started via IntentStarter.startIntent(Intent) or via IntentStarter.startIntentForResult(Intent, int) if the request code specified via requestCode(int) is none-negative number.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the new "content handler" to be displayed within chooser dialog list.
        intent - Intent to be started when an item associated with this handler within chooser dialog is clicked.

    • Method Detail

      • name

        @NonNull
public CharSequence name()
        Returns the name of this handler.
        Returns:
        This handlers's name.

      • intent

        @NonNull
public Intent intent()
        Returns the intent specified for this handler.
        Returns:
        This handler's intent.

      • requestCode

        public ContentIntent.ContentHandler requestCode(int code)
        Sets a request code used when starting the intent specified during initialization.
        Parameters:
        code - The desired request code. This code should be used to identify result from started intent in Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent) or Fragment.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent), depends on from within which context has been ContentIntent started.
        Returns:
        This handler to allow methods chaining.
        See Also:
        requestCode()

      • requestCode

        public int requestCode()
        Returns the request code specified for this handler.
        Returns:
        This handler's request code.
        See Also:
        requestCode(int)
